titleInfo.title: Design of Hurricane Resistant Residential Structure in Florida
titleInfo.subTitle: Construction Strategies for Alleviation and Cost Analysis

name.namePart: Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering

mods:mods.abstract: Natural disasters in Florida threaten the millions of people who live there. Storm in the most frequent natural disaster that leaves behind unimaginable levels of devastation. Hurricanes are created over warm waters by tropical disturbances and when strong enough, they can travel at a speed of more than 155 mph. Many structures run at the risk of total failure of the structure due to the force of winds and storms. The building and engineering sectors are important participants in reducing risks and restoring the essential infrastructural goods many are accustomed to, even if numerous programs and methods exist to return normalcy to inhabitants after a disaster. The major objective of this thesis is to present techniques for construction alleviation against hurricane wind loading to increase the resilience of residential construction in Florida. This thesis is divided into two main goals in order to achieve the results aimed. The first step is to examine the problems caused by hurricane wind loading on residential structures, the construction advice that can be used to get older buildings ready for this natural disaster, and the associated expenses. The second objective of this thesis is to determine how, if the primary residential structure breaks during a storm, a cost-effective safe room can be built to safeguard the occupants. The initial objective of this investigation is to identify structural weaknesses by reviewing the research. Since the structures are composed of various components, it is crucial to identify which ones require attention. The design pressures and forces can then be investigated to find the best building suggestions by calculating the wind loading pressures of the various structures. An engineer's judgment on the likely cost can be generated after the construction recommendations for various types of structures have been established to educate the stakeholder of the recommendation's cost. In short, this study aims to ensure that the rooms are risk-free and cost-effective while also being resistant to hurricane wind loads.
mods:mods.note: A Thesis submitted to the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree of Master of Science.
Yassir AbdelRazig, Professor Directing Thesis; John Sobanjo, Committee Member; Eren Erman Ozguven, Committee Member.
